data.title: Leipzig with children - Family activities
data.meta_description: You can easily spend 1-2 days in Leipzig with children. The city is centrally located in Germany and is therefore also suitable as a weekend trip for families.
data.text:
Leipzig is one of the largest cities in eastern Germany, and you can with children easily one or two days in Leipzig spend. The city is relatively central in Germany and is therefore also suitable as a weekend getaway for families. You should definitely visit the city once, because there are Lots of exciting experiences all year round for you. We have the best Places of interest and Activities in Leipzig with children listed for you. Leipzig is compact, flat and green, making it the ideal place for your short holiday.

Leipzig with children - the top attractions

Leipzig has a lot to offer families in particular. Whether in the Leipzig Zoo or at the Sterntaler puppet theatre - Children can discover a lot and have lots of fun in Leipzig. The city is ideal for a relaxing and eventful family holiday!

Leipzig Zoo

The city's zoo is less than 15 minutes' walk from the centre of Leipzig. The zoo is large and you can easily spend a whole day here with your children. The zoo is divided into six different themed areas: Africa, Asia, South America. Founders Garden, Pongoland and Gondwanaland.

The first three themes, which relate to different continents, speak for themselves and you will find animals from that continent. In the Founders Garden at the entrance to the park, the history of the zoo is explained and the other two themes deserve a little more explanation.

Opening hours: daily 9-19 o'clock

Entrance fees: Adults from €19, children from €12, family ticket €58

Gondwanaland is really cool because an entire tropical rainforest has been recreated under a dome and you can even take a boat through the rainforest in this part of the park. It's very green and you can walk through the greenhouse on wooden walkways. Pongoland is all about monkeys. You can visit various monkeys in this area.

This zoo is home to most of the well-known animals such as the lion, elephant, giraffe, rhinoceros and various monkeys. One of the highlights of the zoo is the koala enclosure. What is particularly nice about the zoo is that there are special routes for the children from time to time, where they have to climb and scramble around the various enclosures and where they have a better view of the animals.

The zoo also has two playgrounds, next to which parents can eat and drink while the children play. One play structure is shaped like a boat and the other is a whole structure in the shape of a three-headed dragon. There is also a little train that runs through the zoo.

Of course, there are also plenty of places to eat at the zoo. The prices are quite reasonable and it is possible to buy a family ticket with a discount.

Belantis amusement park

There is a large amusement park for children in the south of the city of Leipzig, about 20 minutes away by car. The amusement park is built on a former lignite mine. It is the largest amusement park in eastern Germany. The park is divided into seven themed areas: the realm of the Temple of the Sun, the Prairie of the Indians, the Island of Knights, the Land of Tombs, the Coast of Explorers, the Beach of the Gods and the Valley of the Pharaohs.

Opening hours: April to October 10-17 h

Entrance fees: Day ticket from € 29.90

The entire amusement park is built around a large lake, which is supposed to represent the Mediterranean Sea. At the entrance, you arrive at Belantis Castle with several halls and squares. From there, you can walk to the various themed areas. The amusement park has some fast-paced rides, but also many family attractions.

Some attractions have a minimum height requirement, so check online beforehand which attractions your children are allowed to enter. There are also several shows you can watch at the amusement park. The amusement park also has two different playgrounds for children and a water playground for warmer days.

he park is only half full, so more attractions will be added in the coming years. Of course, there are also many restaurants in the amusement park where you can eat and drink. The park is open from April to November and the entrance fee is quite high. Mainly because it is not an oversized amusement park.

Panorama tower

If you want a great view in Leipzig with children, the Panorama Tower is a very good option. This skyscraper is located right in the city centre and for a few euros you can go up to the 31st floor, where there is a roof terrace and you have a 360-degree view over the city. The shape of the 142.5 metre high skyscraper is unusual and the roof looks like a ski jump.

Opening hours: daily 09:00 - 22:00; Sun. 9:00 - 21:30

Admission prices: Children up to 8 years free, adults: €5

If you and your family order a drink in the café one floor below the tower's viewing platform, you will get the entrance fee back. This skyscraper also has a small playground with some play equipment for children.

Incidentally, the Panorama Tower is not the only place from which you have a great view of the city. There is also St Thomas' Church right in the city centre, where you can climb the more than 200 steps of the church tower and also have a beautiful view of the city. For the price, you don't have to settle for just one of the two viewpoints.

Monument to the Battle of Nations

This is one of the largest war memorials in Europe. When you stand in front of the memorial, you can only imagine how huge the building is. You can enter the memorial and learn about the history of the battle that took place here during the First World War.

There are huge statues in the building and you can take the stairs to the top and have a great view of the city of Leipzig from the 91 metre high building. The building is located just outside the city and takes about 20 minutes by tram from the city centre. Children up to the age of five can visit the monument inside for free.

The memorial is located at the foot of a large city park, which is perfect for a walk with your children. There are also several statues in the park that commemorate the First World War.

Leipzig with children - Other activities

Schreberbad: Swimming fun on hot days? The Schreberbad is well worth a visit. Here, families can not only swim, splash and slide, but also play volleyball, basketball and table tennis and hire play equipment.

Markkleeberg Canoe Park: In the Markkleeberg Canoe Park fun is guaranteed. Things get wild at the Rafting, surfing or surfing! Here parents and older children can put their skills to the test on the wild water.

Tour with Trabants: You can also visit the city of Leipzig with children in an old Trabant discover the city. Guided by a tour guide, you can explore the city in a Column of old Trabants in one and a half hours explore. The cars are not particularly big, but with small children in the back seat it should definitely work.

City parksLeipzig has a number of city parks that are worth a visit with children. Friedenspark is located pretty much right in the city centre and has a playground and a small botanical garden. There are also lots of green spaces in this park where you can have a great family picnic. This city park is about half an hour's walk from the city centre. The second city park is the Clara Zetkins Park and this one is much bigger. This park is quite large and has several lakes and several playgrounds, with the Clarapark playground being a must.

Canoeing: The river flows through the city of Leipzig River Elster flood bed and on this river you can canoe with children. You can rent these canoes from March to October and pay a price per hour. There are canoes for one, two and three people, so you can also take children together in a canoe. The Canoe hire is located near the Clara Zetkins Park mentioned above.

Unikatum Children's Museum: A small museumwhich is largely run by volunteers and where children can discover things through various interactive exhibits. If you enjoy visiting a museum in Leipzig with children, this is a good option.

Leipzig Christmas Market

One of the largest and most beautiful Christmas markets in Germany is located in Leipzig. The tradition of this Christmas market dates back to the 15th century and the market is very atmospheric. The market has up to 250 stalls and starts in the last week of November and lasts until Christmas Day. The Christmas market runs for a total of 28 days.

This Christmas market is also very family-friendly. Among other things, there is a fairytale tree, Father Christmas comes to visit and there is a children's area. You can visit the market with your children at the beginning of the Christmas holidays, for example, if they are free and you are planning a city trip to Leipzig with children.

Car hire tips for Leipzig

If you want to do the activities described above in Leipzig with children, a car may be quite practical. There is generally public transport in the city, but having your own car can of course also be an option. We find that the cars from DiscoverCars are always first class!

Here, all costs are actually included in the price and you are insured for most things (including your excess). In the past, we've had problems with this with other hire companies because all kinds of costs were added on at the destination. With Sunny Cars you know that's not the case and that's a good feeling. You can also cancel the car 1 hour before your reservation free of charge. You can also hire a car in Leipzig with children at Sunny Cars. Take a look at the different hire cars here.

Where you can stay overnight in Leipzig with children
